item.title: Supply chain attack hits Gluestack NPM packages with 960K weekly downloads
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A significant supply chain attack hit NPM after 15 popular Gluestack packages with over 950,000 weekly downloads were compromised to include malicious code that acts as a remote access trojan (RAT). [...]

item.title: Malicious npm packages posing as utilities delete project directories
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Two malicious packages have been discovered in the npm JavaScript package index, which masquerades as useful utilities but, in reality, are destructive data wipers that delete entire application directories. [...]

item.title: Microsoft shares script to restore inetpub folder you shouldn’t delete
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has released a PowerShell script to help restore an empty 'inetpub' folder created by the April 2025 Windows security updates if deleted. As Microsoft previously warned, this folder helps mitigate a high-severity Windows Process Activation privilege escalation vulnerability. [...]

item.title: Tax resolution firm Optima Tax Relief hit by ransomware, data leaked
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: U.S. tax resolution firm Optima Tax Relief suffered a Chaos ransomware attack, with the threat actors now leaking data stolen from the company. [...]

item.title: Kettering Health confirms Interlock ransomware behind cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Healthcare giant Kettering Health, which manages 14 medical centers in Ohio, confirmed that the Interlock ransomware group breached its network and stole data in a May cyberattack. [...]

item.title: New PathWiper data wiper malware hits critical infrastructure in Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new data wiper malware named 'PathWiper' is being used in targeted attacks against critical infrastructure in Ukraine, aimed at disrupting operations in the country. [...]

item.title: Critical Fortinet flaws now exploited in Qilin ransomware attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Qilin ransomware operation has recently joined attacks exploiting two Fortinet vulnerabilities that allow bypassing authentication on vulnerable devices and executing malicious code remotely. [...]

item.title: Police arrests 20 suspects for distributing child sexual abuse content
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Law enforcement authorities from over a dozen countries have arrested 20 suspects in an international operation targeting the production and distribution of child sexual abuse material. [...]

item.title: Google’s upcoming Gemini Kingfall is allegedly a coding beast
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google's AI advancement is not slowing down, and we might be getting yet another powerful model codenamed "Gemini Kingfall." [...]

item.title: ChatGPT prepares o3-pro model for $200 Pro subscribers
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is planning to ship an update to ChatGPT that will turn on the new o3 Pro model, which has more compute to think harder. [...]

item.title: FBI: BADBOX 2.0 Android malware infects millions of consumer devices
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The FBI is warning that the BADBOX 2.0 malware campaign has infected over 1 million home Internet-connected devices, converting consumer electronics into residential proxies that are used for malicious activity. [...]

item.title: Old AT&T data leak repackaged to link SSNs, DOBs to 49M phone numbers
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A threat actor has re-released data from a 2021 AT&T breach affecting 70 million customers, this time combining previously separate files to directly link Social Security numbers and birth dates to individual users. [...]
